docs.snippet: The United States Lines trans ported nearly 150,000 passengers in 951 sailings in 1946, it was an nounced yesterday by company of ficials. The sailings were made by American-flag vessels owned or chartered by the company, or owned by the Government...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Lines trans ported nearly 150,000 passengers in 951 sailings in 1946, it was an nounced yesterday by company of ficials. The sailings were made by American-flag vessels owned or chartered by the company, or owned by the Government and operated by United States Lines as general agent for the Maritime Commission.

docs.snippet: WEEK ENDED JAN. 11, 1947 It was another week of light business and minor price changes in the foreign exchange market. Interest centered almost entirely in the routine day-to-day requirements which were negotiated at no striking variation over those...
docs.lead_paragraph: WEEK ENDED JAN. 11, 1947 It was another week of light business and minor price changes in the foreign exchange market. Interest centered almost entirely in the routine day-to-day requirements which were negotiated at no striking variation over those of the preceding week.

docs.snippet: Education for women has fallen to "alarming depths" in fifteen countries of Europe, the Orient and Latin America, according to a report by the American YWCA, which is conducting a campaign this month and next to raise $2,100,000 for rehabilitation...
docs.lead_paragraph: Education for women has fallen to "alarming depths" in fifteen countries of Europe, the Orient and Latin America, according to a report by the American YWCA, which is conducting a campaign this month and next to raise $2,100,000 for rehabilitation purposes.
docs.abstract: YWCA rept shows need for women's educ in Eur, Orient and Latin Amer; plans programs; describes classes under way

docs.snippet: SOME San Franciscans are viewing the Metropolitan Opera's plans for West Coast visits with alarm. They see them as a threat to their own opera company, which has, been operating for twenty-four seasons under Gaetano Merola.
